definition: Peiping or Beiping (name of Beijing at different periods, esp. 1928-1949)
north/(classical) to be defeated
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
surname Ping
North China Plain
Northeast Plain, also called the Manchurian Plain

sentences.english: After the War of Resistance Against Japan, Tsinghua University was removed from Kunming to Beiping in 1946.
sentences.chinese: 清華大學在抗戰勝利後的1946年由昆明遷回北平。

sentences.english: Studying on groundwater in Hebei Plain has been an academic focus all the time.
sentences.chinese: 河北平原地下水的研究一直以來都是學者關注的焦點。

sentences.english: It was discovered that the whole of Hebei plain show a descending tendency.
sentences.chinese: 整個河北平原都存在着下降的趨勢。

sentences.english: When Japan captured Peiping, Kao led his gendarmes into the countryside to fight a guerrilla war.
sentences.chinese: 日本侵入北平後，他帶領他的警察到農村打游擊。

sentences.english: Beiping in China in the past.
sentences.chinese: 過去的中國曾有一個叫北平的城市。

sentences.english: It was in 1937 when Japanese soldiers broke into the city Beiping.
sentences.chinese: 日本鬼子闖入北平城是在一九三七年。

sentences.english: The drought and crop failure were the most serious in North China in a hundred years.
sentences.chinese: 那幾年，華北平原發生了百年不遇的大旱災和歉收。

sentences.english: He graduated from the Chinese department of Literature Istitute of Beijing Normal University.
sentences.chinese: 北平師範大學文學院國文學系畢業。

sentences.english: You know him to come to Beiping for the sake of what?
sentences.chinese: 你可知道他到北平來爲了什麼？

sentences.english: Life was so terrible that he often thought to run back to Peiping.
sentences.chinese: 生活變得極端困苦，他常常產生跑回北平去的念頭。

sentences.english: The second part is divided into the Pinghua passive tags on it.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分爲桂北平話被動標記研究。

sentences.english: Tuanbowa Reservoir is a saline-alkaline man-made lake in the North China plain.
sentences.chinese: 天津市團泊窪水庫屬華北平原濱海鹽鹼性水庫。

sentences.english: My hometown lies on the Plain of North China.
sentences.chinese: 我的家鄉位於華北平原。

sentences.english: When sixteen, he came to Peiping.
The third part is researched disposal tag of the Pinghua .
sentences.chinese: 第三部分是桂北平話處置標記研究。

sentences.english: Fled to peiping road, two men met horse small wan.
sentences.chinese: 逃往北平路上，二人結識了馬小宛。

definition: old name for district of Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
Fu Zuoyi (1895-1974), Guomindang general, subsequently PRC top general and politician
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Rehe, Qing dynasty province abolished in 1955 and divided among Hebei, Liaoning and Inner Mongolia/refers to the Qing imperial resort at Chengde/see also 避暑山莊|避暑山庄[bi4 shu3 shan1 zhuang1] (history)
capital of a country (literary)
old name for Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
Shanxi 山西, Chahar 察哈爾|察哈尔 and Hebei 河北 (three provinces of the Republic of China in the period 1912-1936)
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
incident/unforeseen event/events (in general)
the Northern Expeditionary Army
Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi
capital of a country
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Manchukuo
Pingjin Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War
